meanings.definition: A reduction in speed or pace.
meanings.sent1: The slowdown of the turtle made it easier for the rabbit to win the race.
meanings.sent2: The traffic slowdown caused me to be late for work.
meanings.sent3: The snail's slowdown was so extreme that even the sloth laughed.
meanings.sent4: The economic slowdown hit the country like a sudden storm.
meanings.sent5: The slowdown of the waterfall created a peaceful and serene atmosphere.

meanings.definition: A delay or decrease in progress or activity.
meanings.sent1: The slowdown in production was due to a shortage of materials.
meanings.sent2: The project experienced a slowdown when key team members were absent.
meanings.sent3: The snail's slowdown in eating its lettuce was quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The slowdown in internet speed felt like trying to run through molasses.
meanings.sent5: The slowdown in the music tempo added a dramatic effect to the performance.
